metadata.titel_preek: A Doxological Vote for the Common Good

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Spirit of God explodes the familiar world of parsimony and scarcity to establish a new reality of abundance for all creatures.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Spirit of God enters into our familiar worlds and explodes them
The Spirit is always contradicting our strategies of parsimony.
God-given abundance is not private... It is for all the neighbors
the common good where all can eat and be filled
the good God of creation declared parsimony to be a phony economic distortion
gifts given by the Lord of creation!
all creatures of our God and King
everyone who is thirsty; everyone who is hungry
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is invited to identify as a Receiver of abundance who then becomes a voter for it.

tekstueel_bewijs: Doxology... is a way of voting for gracious abundance
this poet Isaiah broke that parsimony with his poetry
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; the Spirit is the explosive power.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Ideology of Parsimony / Imperial Economy
tekstueel_bewijs: a world of parsimony and anxiety
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Parsimony is treated as a 'false world' or 'ideology' that blinds and enslaves humanity, requiring a divine 'explosion' to break.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of 'voting' for the common good through doxology and action.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (God's abundance) enables the secondary program (human voting/action). We vote because 'we know better' due to God's act.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Doxological Poetry → The Spirit ← Ideology of Scarcity

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Spirit of God enters into our familiar worlds
The Lord upholds all who are falling
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we keep on our horizon only those who belong to our group

voorbeelden: The reason we must talk about this
we may sign on for the common good
The poet who knows their anxiety
the Spirit exploded... and breaks open

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on 'Knowing' (Savoir) the truth of abundance to counteract the 'Falsehood' of parsimony, which then grants the 'Power' (Pouvoir) to live differently.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Parsimony) to S1 (God's Abundance) via the negation of S2 (Exposing the fraud).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'explosion' of the Spirit which reveals that S2 was always a 'fraud'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; described as a predatory, exclusionary world that 'messed up the environment'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. God/The Spirit is the primary actor who initiates the change. Human action is a 'doxological' response to a prior divine reality.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We vote with our tongues, and then with our feet and our hands

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as active Subject of salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He cured their sicknesses! ... He fed them!
He did not ask about their coverage or their qualifications

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is not an example to follow but a 'performance' of God's reality to be received.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Jesus is the Subject who acts upon the crowd, not a model for the crowd's behavior.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from anxiety and empowerment for 'doxological' living.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification by grace leads to the sanctification of the common good.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from God's abundance to human 'voting' is logically and theologically integrated through the concept of 'knowing better'.
spanning_punten: The shift from cosmic abundance to specific political policies (tax policy, gerrymandering) may feel jarring to some, though structurally consistent.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The Spirit explodes and breaks open the unfair arrangements... the grip of the imperial economy is broken.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit grants 'Savoir' (knowing the truth) and 'Pouvoir' (breaking the grip of fear).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a systemic 'ideology of scarcity' that enslaves the mind and economy.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: Strong theocentric structure where God/Spirit is the Subject of the primary narrative program.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (the Spirit's specific enabling of the 'feet and hands').
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly link the Spirit's power to the specific acts of 'voting with feet'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon masterfully avoids moralism by grounding social ethics in the prior, explosive action of the Spirit.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'all, all, all' repetition, Greimas analysis shows that 'all' is the Receiver actant, proving the universal scope of the Object (Abundance).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical context of Isaiah; Greimas shows Isaiah functions as a 'Helper' actant providing 'Savoir' to the Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Doxology' is not just a conclusion but a functional 'Helper' that allows the human Subject to transition from the world of Parsimony to the world of Abundance.

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (cured, fed, took, blessed, broke, gave)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'voting' as a metaphor for actantial performance.
